intro: Eriospermum pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by fluffy, white seed heads that resemble dandelion fluff. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
